id: Trevor McDonald and the Killer Nurse, review: new research bolsters this Beverley Allitt investigation
paragraph:
It’s a curious hobby for a knight of the realm to take up in retirement: making documentaries about serial killers. Trevor McDonald and the Killer Nurse (ITV) was the latest in a long line of true-crime films made by our 79-year-old foremost former newsreader. All of them perform an odd balancing act: the telling of nightmarish stories by possibly the cosiest and most reassuring man on television.This film focused on one of the cruellest killing sprees of the Nineties: that by 22-year-old nurse Beverley Allitt, who was convicted 25 years ago for the murder of four children in her care, the attempted murder of three more and grievous bodily harm to a further six.
